articles.author: Chris Prentice, Carolina Mandl
articles.description: The U.S. securities regulator has collected thousands of staff messages from more than a dozen major investment companies, escalating its probe into Wall Street's use of private messaging apps, said four people with direct knowledge of the matter.
articles.title: Exclusive: SEC collects Wall Street's private messages as WhatsApp probe escalates -sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Authorities in China have ordered a senior Nomura Holdings (8604.T) banker overseeing the firm's investment banking operations there not to leave the mainland, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.
articles.title: China bans Nomura senior investment banker from leaving mainland -sources

articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin, Olesya Astakhova
articles.description: The heads of Russian energy giants Gazprom (GAZP.MM) and Rosneft (ROSN.MM), Alexei Miller and Igor Sechin, will join President Vladimir Putin's retinue during his visit to China next month, sources familiar with the plans told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russia's top oil and gas chiefs to accompany Putin on China visit

articles.author: Ann Saphir
articles.description: It's a now-familiar dance: Federal Reserve officials signal to the world that interest rates are not dropping anytime soon. Financial markets respond with bets to the contrary.
articles.title: Why traders aren't buying the Fed's 'higher-for-longer' vision

articles.author: Jeffrey Dastin
articles.description: Amazon.com (AMZN.O) on Monday said it will invest up to $4 billion in cash in the high-profile startup Anthropic, in its effort to compete with growing cloud rivals on artificial intelligence.
articles.title: Amazon steps up AI race with up to $4 billion deal to invest in Anthropic

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British retailers reported a smaller annual fall in sales for September than during the previous month and expect a modest improvement in the months ahead, the Confederation of British Industry (CBI) said on Monday.
articles.title: Slump in UK retail sales eases in September, CBI says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's financial regulators proposed guidance on Monday for financial firms to tackle sexual harassment and bullying, along with new requirements for large banks and insurers to set targets to improve diversity and inclusion.
articles.title: Britain proposes diversity and misconduct rules for financial firms

articles.author: Gram Slattery, James Oliphant, Nathan Layne
articles.description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis had a chance in April to address Donald Trump's growing momentum toward the 2024 Republican presidential nomination. Like several such opportunities, he let it pass him by.
articles.title: How DeSantis' early missteps hobbled his U.S. presidential bid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of ethnic Armenians fled the breakaway region of Nagorno-Karabakh on Monday, queuing up for fuel and jamming the road to Armenia after their decades-old separatist state was defeated by Azerbaijan in a lightning military operation.
articles.title: Ethnic Armenians flee Karabakh after breakaway region's defeat

articles.author: Mohammad Yunus Yawar, Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: The Taliban are creating a large-scale camera surveillance network for Afghan cities that could involve repurposing a plan crafted by the Americans before their 2021 pullout, an interior ministry spokesman told Reuters, as authorities seek to supplement thousands of cameras already across the capital, Kabul.
articles.title: Exclusive: Taliban weighs using U.S. mass surveillance plan, met with China's Huawei
